title: Cycling Plus’ April issue on sale now with 52-page guide to the 2023 pro season
content:
The April 2023 edition of Cycling Plus is out now, complete with a review of three go-anywhere gravel bikes, the best lightweight jackets on test, and ultimate yet easy ways to improve your cycling nutrition. Plus, there’s a pull-out 52-page guide to the 2023 pro racing season.

If you subscribe today, you’ll get a Lezyne Pocket Drive Pump worth £29 and save 31 per cent!

52-page 2023 Season Preview

Each edition comes with a pull-out 52-page pocket guide to the 2023 pro cycling season. The packed supplement includes all the major events, from February’s UAE Tour to Il Lombardia in October, via the Giro, Tour de France and Vuelta. There’s also a guide to the best men’s and women’s teams, and their key podium contenders.

 

Gravel bikes on test

In this month’s major bike test, the team rate three genre-spanning, go-anywhere gravel bikes under £2,600 from Orro, Scott and Surly.

 

In-depth features

In Features, we reveal sure-fire ways to avoid saddle sores when riding, take on the Il Lombardia Gran Fondo in Italy and Raiders Gravel stage event in Scotland, and provide 15 easy ways to fuel your riding.

Top tech

In cycling’s best reviews section, the team give their verdicts on this season’s lightweight jackets, ride BMC’s Roadmachine AMP One, award a rare five-star review to Litelok’s new X1 lock (as well as an even rarer one-star review of the Limits Bia Power Meter), and search out the most durable winter tyres.

 

There’s also a test of the best £2,500 commuting ebikes…

… and the best kit picks for indoor riding.
